page.title: 01North-east of the Longmynd
page.content: This is a rural area of South Shropshire situated on the edge of the National Trust land of the Longmynd where the rolling hills open out into the valley. The majority of residents live in the village of Leebotwood and the hamlets of Smethcott and Woolstaston but there are other small scattered communities such as Padmore and Lower Wood, each with their own particular identity. There are three Anglican churches in the area, but no schools or health services. A main road, A.49, and a regular bus service run through the east side of the area, as does a railway line, but there is no railway station. Farming is the main occupation although small commercial ventures are apparent and retired people and commuters are moving into the area.
